III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty
to perform the prescribed functions required by these
administrative rules and in the agency's program statement
and to provide for the continual needs, protection, and
supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 11/19/2024 Youth A was physically assaulted by Youth B and
Youth C and it was alleged staff were not able to intervene
properly.
Investigation The complainant was contacted on 01/17/2025 and no additional
information was provided.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 11/20/2024 with DHHS Worker 1 and
DHHS Worker 2 during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the
facility. She recalled the incident starting in the pod where Youth
A was arguing with Youth B and Youth C, and Staff 1 has not
been able to verbally de-escalate Youth A. Youth A had a
broomstick in his hand because he was in the process of cleaning
up papers he had ripped up and thrown all over the floor of the
pod. He proceeded to throw the broomstick at Youth B. Staff 1
recalled Youth B charged at Youth A and it appeared to her he
intended to fight. Staff 1 stated she tried to restrain Youth B from
getting to Youth A. She stated Youth B, and then Youth C, were
able to get to Youth A and physically assault Youth A despite her
efforts to stop it. As this occurred Staff 1 called a “code red”,
which alerted senior staff to come to the pod to assist in de-
escalating the situation. Staff 1 could not recall the exact details
of Youth B and Youth C assaulting Youth A, other than to state
she was trying to stop them and was unsuccessful. Staff 1
recalled Youth A eventually being on the floor near the entrance of
the showers, curled up in a ball as Youth C tried to kick him. Staff
1 recalled both Youth B and Youth C immediately stopped as
other staff came in to the pod to assist. Staff 1 stated she knew
the assault on Youth A was bad, and also believed she could have
tried to restrain Youth A to prevent the situation from escalating
2

but was not confident in doing so because of the physical threat
posed by Youth B and Youth C.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 11/20/2024 with DHHS Worker 1 and
DHHS Worker 2 during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the
facility. She recalled Youth A being calm earlier in the day but
then getting more and more bothered as the afternoon went
on. This culminated in Youth A arguing with Youth B and Youth C
while in the pod. Staff 2 recalled Youth A having a broomstick in
his hand and he eventually made threatening motions with it
towards Youth B. This quickly escalated to punches being thrown
between Youth A and Youth B. Staff 2 recalled seeing Youth B hit
Youth A as she tried to intervene between them. She believed
Youth B was able to pick up Youth A and slam him on a
table. Staff 2 recalled Youth A making his way towards the
entrance of the showers, only for Youth C to continue to assault
him there. This occurred after Youth A threw something at Youth
C, but Staff 2 could not recall what that was. Staff 2 recalled
trying to shield Youth A, who was on the ground, from Youth C but
was unsuccessful in doing so. Youth C kicked and hit Youth A
while Youth A was on the ground. Staff 2 recalled Youth C
immediately stopped assaulting Youth A when other staff came on
to the pod to assist, and that was the end of the incident.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 11/20/2024 with DHHS Worker 1 and
DHHS Worker 2 during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the
facility. Staff 3 had interacted with Youth A earlier in the day and
recalled him being upset and beginning to have escalated
behavior, but Youth A was not able to verbalize why. Staff 3
stated his involvement in the fight came when he was alerted to it,
and he ran back to the pod. Once entering the pod Staff 3
recalled seeing Youth B and Youth C talking to each other and
other staff being with Youth A. Youth A was bleeding from his
face, so Staff 3 took him to the nurse for medical attention.
Staff 4 was interviewed on 11/20/2024 with DHHS Worker 1 and
DHHS Worker 2 during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the
facility. He recalled his involvement in the incident started with
being called to the pod because of a “code red” procedure. At that
time the fight had ended. Staff 4 stated that his job at that point
was to address Youth B and Youth C as other staff were tending
to Youth A and his injuries.
Staff 5 was interviewed on 11/20/2024 with DHHS Worker 1 and
DHHS Worker 2 during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the
facility. Staff 5 believed he arrived to the pod first as a result of
3

the “code red” procedure. Staff 5 noted the first thing he saw
upon entering the pod was a broken broomstick, paper shredded
all over the floor and spots of blood on the floor. He recalled
seeing Youth A laying on the ground near the entrance of the
showers. At that time Youth C was standing over Youth A, and
Staff 5 recalled restraining Youth C to get him away from Youth
A. Staff 5 believed Youth C did not resist and moved away from
the situation willingly. Staff 5 helped attend to Youth A and his
injuries, and could not comment on anything else involving Youth
B and Youth C from that point on.
Youth A was interviewed on 11/20/2024 with DHHS Worker 1 and
DHHS Worker 2 during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the
facility. He recalled the incident started because he was arguing
with Youth B about something. Youth A stated he walked away
from Youth B only for Youth B to punch him in the face. Youth A
recalled fighting back with Youth B briefly only to get away from
him. As this occurred Youth A heard Youth C laughing and he
believed it was directed at him. Youth A recalled throwing
something at Youth C, and Youth C then charged him. Youth A
stated he remembered what happened next but because it
occurred so fast, he was not sure if Youth C punched or kicked
him. Youth A was on the ground at that point, and he recalled one
of the female staff standing over him trying to protect him from
Youth C. Youth A remembered the incident ending quickly, and
he didn’t see Youth B or Youth C after that point. Staff helped him
up and he believed he was immediately taken to the nurse. Youth
A commented he was not with the nurse long before it was
decided he be taken to the hospital for further medical
attention. Youth A remarked that, while he could not recall which
staff were in the pod with him, they were trying to de-escalate the
situation and trying to protect him from Youth B and Youth
C. Youth A did not believe the incident occurred because staff did
not act quickly enough or were not present. Youth A noted he
was moved pods since the incident, and he believed he was safer
in his new pod because of the mix of youth in it with him.
Staff 6 was interviewed on 11/20/2024 with DHHS Worker 1 and
DHHS Worker 2 during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the
facility. He recalled hearing a “code red” and responding to the
pod. When he arrived, he witnessed Youth A laying on the
ground, balled up in a fetal position and bleeding from his
face. Youth B and Youth C were in the pod but staying away from
Youth A at that point in time.
4

Youth B was interviewed on 11/20/2024 with DHHS Worker 1 and
DHHS Worker 2 during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the
facility. Youth B refused to provide any information for this
interview.
Youth C was interviewed on 11/20/2024 with DHHS Worker 1 and
DHHS Worker 2 during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the
facility. He heard Youth A threatening and challenging Youth C
and Youth B to fight repeatedly. Youth C would not comment on
Youth B’s involvement. He stated he started to fight Youth A after
Youth A threw something at him. Youth C recalled Staff 2
attempting to stop him, but he believed she was not going to be
successful at doing so. Youth C stopped trying to fight Youth A
because of his own choice and denied that anyone stopped him
from doing so. He recalled several other staff coming in to the
pod but could not recall what they did or said to him or the other
youth.
Youth D was interviewed on 11/20/2024 with DHHS Worker 1 and
DHHS Worker 2 during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the
facility. He stated he was in the pod and saw the entirety of the
situation but was uninvolved. Youth D recalled Youth A was
verbally escalated, and eventually was made threatening
statements to Youth B and Youth C. Youth D saw Youth A throw
a broom at Youth B. Youth D commented Staff 1 and Staff 2 were
present and attempted to stop the escalation and were just
unsuccessful in doing so. Youth D witnessed Youth B assault
Youth A, and the same thing occurring between Youth C and
Youth A. Youth D stated the whole incident ended when other
staff came to the pod to assist.
Video reviewed:
• Security camera footage dated 11/19/2024 was reviewed.
The footage had visual glitches that made some moments
difficult to assess, but they did not preclude the overall
assessment of the incident. At 2:39pm Youth A could be
seen standing near the closed door to the pod with a broom
in his hand. Youth B and Youth C were near the other
corner of the open area of the pod. Staff 1 and Staff 2 were
positioned near the control room, within a few feet of all of
the youth. Youth D was seen sitting on the far end of the
pod on his own. No other individuals were
present. Approximately one minute later Youth B
approached Youth A near the door of the pod, and Staff 1
and Staff 2 moved towards Youth A and Youth B. With all
the individuals near the door the next minute could not
5

clearly be seen until Youth B was seen with a broom
handle. Staff 1 attempted to stay in between Youth A and
Youth B, but Youth B could be seen cornering Youth A and
swinging his broom handle at him. Youth A then moved
away toward the center of the pod. Youth B followed, still
holding the broomstick. Within the next minute Youth A
and Youth B began to fight, with Staff 1 and Staff 2
attempting to physically intervene. Youth C began to
engage in the fight. Youth B was able to pick up Youth A
and move him away from the staff, and Youth A was then
next seen on the floor. Staff 2 attempted to stay in between
Youth A and the others. Youth A picked up a broomstick
and another item and threw the other item in the direction
of Youth C. Youth C approached and Youth C, Staff 2 and
Youth A moved out of view near the area of the entrance of
the pod’s showers. The back of Youth C could be seen
throwing punches downwards. At the same time Youth B
was near the door to the pod and Staff 1 was attempting to
block him from moving back towards Youth A, Youth C and
Staff 2. Youth B was able to get away and was next seen
in the same area as Youth A, although it could not be
determined what was occurring. At that time Youth C had
moved away, and Staff 1 walked towards Youth A’s
location and out of view. Staff 5 was then seen walking in
the pod towards the location of Youth A. As more staff
entered the pod Youth B and Youth C moved away from
the situation on their own. The incident appeared to have
ended at 2:41 pm as Youth A was tended to and Youth B
and Youth C sat near a far wall of the pod.
Documentation reviewed:
• Police report documentation dated 11/19/2024 from the
Highland Park Police Department. Law enforcement came
to the facility after the incident had ended and spoke with
Youth A. Youth A had fresh facial injuries and described
the incident consistent with interviews and video footage.
• Safety planning documentation was provided and
reviewed. This stated staff would ensure Youth A would
not have contact with Youth B and Youth C.
• Hospital discharge documentation dated 11/19/2024 was
provided and reviewed. Youth A was diagnosed with an
orbital fracture and a possible retinal detachment. It was
documented there was no concern over a traumatic brain
injury. Youth A was prescribed pain medication and follow
up was referred for an oculoplastic surgeon assessment.
6

• Facility incident report documentation dated 11/19/2024
was provided and reviewed. Details in this documentation
were consistent with what was provided in interviews and
video footage.
• Facility policy and procedure titled “Verbal Intervention”
was reviewed. This policy outlined levels of youth behavior
that required leveled intervention, including staff responding
to youth verbal aggression with verbal limit-setting
techniques and staff responding to youth physical assault
with safe physical management procedures.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per youth and staff
interviews, documentation, and video reviewed staff appropriately
intervened during the incident.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Incident reporting
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4150
Section (1) Any incident resulting in serious injury of a resident or illness
Description requiring inpatient hospitalization, shall be reported to the
parent/ legal guardian, responsible referring agency, and the
licensing authority as soon as possible, but not more than 24
hours after the incident.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation The facility did not provide timely notice to applicable parties of the
hospitalization of Youth A on 11/19/2024.
Investigation The complainant was contacted on 01/27/2025 and no additional
information was provided.
The Licensee Designee and Chief Administrator were
interviewed on 11/20/2024 with DHHS Worker 1 and DHHS
Worker 2 during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the
facility. They reported all applicable parties had been notified of
the incident and done so within 24 hours, as the incident occurred
mid-afternoon on 11/19/2024 and Youth A’s trip to the hospital
occurred in the late evening of 11/19/2024.
Licensing Consultant 1 was notified of the incident and
hospitalization of Youth A during the unannounced, face-to-face
visit to the facility on 11/20/2024.
Documentation reviewed:
• Police report documentation dated 11/19/2024 from the
Highland Park Police Department. Law enforcement noted
7

that as of 11:37pm Youth A’s mother had not been
contacted about the incident and the resulting hospital trip
to treat his injuries.
• Youth A’s foster care case record was reviewed, and it was
documented that facility staff had first contacted with Youth
A’s DHHS Foster Care worker on 11/20/2024 at 8:27am.
The narrative in this documentation described initial
conversations about what occurred in the incident and
immediate assessment and medical treatment for Youth A.
• Medical documentation for the hospitalization of Youth A on
11/19/2024 was provided and reviewed. Youth A received
treatment at Detroit Medical Center and was discharged on
11/19/2024 without being admitted for inpatient
hospitalization.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per interviews and
documentation reviewed the youth was never admitted for
inpatient hospitalization so notifications were not required per rule.
CONSULTATION
The facility was provided with consultation to discuss internal
policy & procedure to address notification of serious injury to
parents/legal guardians, and referral resources quickly.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
